Structs/Clip.html#/videoURL.name: videoURL
Structs/Clip.html#/videoURL.abstract: The video URL where the trimmed Clip can be downloaded and played from

Structs/Clip.html#/thumbnailURL.name: thumbnailURL
Structs/Clip.html#/thumbnailURL.abstract: An optional thumbnail URL for this Clip

Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.name: clipShareViewControllerDidFailLoadingClip(_:)
Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.abstract: Called when the underlying clip for the provided SportEventSnapResultEntry failed loading. This is a terminal state and you should most likely dismiss the ClipShareViewController and navigate back to Snap UI or some other screen of your application.

Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.name: clipShareViewControllerDidFailCreatingClip(_:)
Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.abstract: Called when the trimmed clip could not be created for some reason. This is not a terminal state and the user could try again. Decide on your own if you want to dismiss the ClipShareViewController on your own.

Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.name: clipShareViewController(_:didCreateClip:)
Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.abstract: Called when the user finished trimming a clip and the clip was created. This is not a terminal state and the user can continue to trim another clip if desired. You should decide on your own if you want to dismiss the ClipShareViewController in this case or give the user some indication that the clip was created.

Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.name: clipShareShouldPrefetchURLs(_:)
Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.abstract: Called when ClipShare has loaded the snap information and wants to trigger prefetching of images. Should return a prefetchToken or another disable object that causes prefetching to stop when it is deallocated

Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.name: clipShareShouldLoadImageFrom(url:intoImageView:completion:)
Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.abstract: Called when the given image URL should be loaded in the given UIImageView

Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.name: clipShareShouldCancelImageLoadingIn(imageView:)
Protocols/ClipShareDelegate.html#/clipSh.abstract: Called when any optional previous image loading in the given UIImageView should be cancelled

Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/t.name: trimLoadingText
Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/t.abstract: Progress text while snap information is being loaded

Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/e.name: epgTitleText
Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/e.abstract: Epg title text - should include 2 string placeholders.

Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/c.name: clipTimestampText
Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/c.abstract: Text for the timestamp of the snap - should include 2 string placeholders

Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/c.name: clipMaximumLengthHint
Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/c.abstract: Hint about the maximum length of the clip - should include 1 string placeholder

Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/s.name: snapLoadingFailed
Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/s.abstract: Error message when snap information for the clip could not be loaded

Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/c.name: clipCreationFailedMessage
Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/c.abstract: Error message for alert that is shown when clip creation fails

Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/c.name: clipCreationFailedDismissButton
Classes/ClipShareUIConfiguration.html#/c.abstract: Dismiss button for alert that is shown when clip creation fails

Classes/ClipShare.html#/colorConfigurati.name: colorConfiguration
Classes/ClipShare.html#/colorConfigurati.abstract: Color configuration - preconfigured with default ClipShare values - modify as desired. See documentation for reference in UI designs

Classes/ClipShare.html#/fontConfiguratio.name: fontConfiguration
Classes/ClipShare.html#/fontConfiguratio.abstract: Font configuration - preconfigured with default ClipShare values - modify as desired. See documentation for reference in UI designs

Classes/ClipShare.html#/uiConfiguration.name: uiConfiguration
Classes/ClipShare.html#/uiConfiguration.abstract: UI Configuration for the Clip Trimming UI - preconfigured with default ClipShare values - modify as desired

Classes/ClipShare.html#/setup(environmen.name: setup(environment:)
Classes/ClipShare.html#/setup(environmen.abstract: Initialize ClipShare with a predefined ClipShareEnvironment - the environment should match your SnapscreenEnvironment used for the SnapOdds SDK

Classes/ClipShare.html#/setup(clipShareB.name: setup(clipShareBackendURL:)
Classes/ClipShare.html#/setup(clipShareB.abstract: Initialize ClipShare with a custom backend URL - the backend URL should be compatible with the backendURL passed to the SnapOdds SDK since they share authentication credentials

Classes/ClipShare.html.name: ClipShare
Classes/ClipShare.html.abstract: ClipShare offers the entry point for configuring the SDK.

Classes/ClipShareUIColorConfiguration.ht.name: ClipShareUIColorConfiguration
Classes/ClipShareUIColorConfiguration.ht.abstract: Configuration for colors in ClipShare provided UI.

Classes/ClipShareViewController.html.name: ClipShareViewController
Classes/ClipShareViewController.html.abstract: ClipShareViewController offfers the clip trimming and creation UI including all the video editing logic to your application. Instantiate via the provided class method.
